name: Italian Invasion of Ethiopia
description: Fascist Italy's brutal conquest and occupation of Ethiopia (1935-41). Mussolini's forces used poison gas, massacred civilians, and destroyed Ethiopian Orthodox churches. The 1937 Addis Ababa massacre killed up to 30,000 in retaliation for an assassination attempt.

mortality.note: Includes Graziani massacre (Feb 1937): 19,000-30,000 killed in 3 days. Chemical weapons (mustard gas) used extensively. Clergy and intellectuals systematically targeted. Italy still has not fully acknowledged crimes.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Mustard gas, concentration camps, mass executions. Colonial occupation with brutal suppression.
rationales.profit: Colonial prestige and resources. Mussolini's imperial ambitions.
rationales.ideology: Fascist racism, 'civilizing' rhetoric, revenge for Adwa defeat.
rationales.complicity: Italian military and settlers participated. League of Nations sanctions ineffective. Italy downplays today.

analysis.pattern_note: Fascist colonialism - conquest for imperial glory, not profit (Italy lost money). Mustard gas dropped on civilians, Red Cross camps bombed. Graziani massacre: revenge for assassination attempt killed tens of thousands. 'Vendetta' against only African nation to defeat European power (Battle of Adwa 1896). Still downplayed in Italy - 'Italiani brava gente' myth persists.
analysis.root_causes: Fascist ideology, desire for empire, revenge for Adwa, international weakness

sources.title: The Addis Ababa Massacre: Italy's National Shame
sources.author: Ian Campbell
